alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 3:09AM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Multiple Winter Storms to Impact Mountain and Foothill Travel through Early Next Week... .A series of winter storms will bring multiple rounds of mountain snow and gusty winds through early next week. Mountain snow showers will continue today with the next heavier round of snow occurring this evening through Saturday with lower snow levels. Snow levels will generally be 2000 to 3500 feet but will be lowering Sunday morning to 1000 to 2500 feet, locally lower. Activity will become more showery Saturday night with another round of heavy snow Sunday afternoon and Monday, with some possible snow accumulation down into the lower foothills (1000 feet) Tuesday morning. Major travel delays and difficult travel conditions are anticipated through early next week. Gusty winds will further reduce visibilities during this event with local whiteout conditions possible. Holiday travelers should prepare for winter driving conditions by packing chains, warm winter clothes, and extra food and water. Foothill locations that do not normally receive snow should prepare for winter conditions, especially from Sunday morning through Tuesday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SUNDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected from 1000 to 3000 feet. Travel will be very difficult. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches, with localized amounts up to 2 to 4 feet, are expected. The highest amounts are expected at or above the upper foothills. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Motherlode. * WHEN...4 AM Sunday to 10 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
